author: Filip Timotija
description: Rep. Lloyd Doggett (D-Texas) said during a recent interview that the government failed “at every level” in preparation and response to the deadly flooding in Texas that has killed more than 120 people.  “There are families across the state in tears today, suffering so much loss, and this was totally unnecessary to have this big…
title: Texas Democrat: Government failed ‘at every level’ amid deadly flooding

author: Filip Timotija
description: Palestinian activist Mahmoud Khalil said during a recent appearance on CNN that President Trump’s administration wanted use him as “an example” after he was detained for over three months. “It‘s absurd. It‘s basically to intimidate me. They want to conflate any speech for the right of Palestinians with a speech that‘s supporting terrorism, which is…
title: Mahmoud Khalil: Trump admin wants to ‘make an example out of me’

author: Jonathan Zimmerman, opinion contributor
description: NPR and elite universities have a liberal bias, which can lead to a lack of credibility and vulnerability to Trump's attacks, and should be acknowledged to resist his attempts to stifle inquiry, debate and the free exchange of ideas.
title: On NPR and at elite universities, liberals should openly admit their biases

author: Mary Graham, opinion contributor
description: The New Start Act, introduced by Sens. Ed Markey and Cory Booker, proposes a five-year pilot program to award grants to organizations that train currently and formerly incarcerated individuals in entrepreneurship, aiming to reduce recidivism and grow the economy.
title: Unlock America’s hidden entrepreneurs: Congress must pass the New Start Act now

author: Joseph Choi
description: Senate Republicans remain wary of eliminating the popular and successful global HIV/AIDS program PEPFAR, as they face down a July 18 deadline to vote on President Trump’s first tranche of rescissions requests.  In his rescissions request to Congress last month, Trump asked that $900 million budgeted for the President’s Emergency Plan for AIDS Relief (PEPFAR)…
title: Senate GOP faces ‘gut check time’ on axing global HIV program

author: Doug Pagitt, opinion contributor
description: To become the majority party again, Democrats cannot ignore America's religious majority — Christian voters.
title: The Democratic Party is missing an opportunity to engage Christian voters

author: Rebecca Beitsch
description: A Supreme Court decision giving the Trump administration the greenlight to lay off tens of thousands of employees threatens to reshape the federal workforce amid a broader battle over whether the president has the power to do so. The Tuesday decision was the latest example of the court stepping in to stop a nationwide injunction…
title: Federal employees bracing after Supreme Court greenlights widespread layoffs

author: Douglas MacKinnon, opinion contributor
description: A number of Republicans and conservatives I speak with are increasingly worried about the next two election cycles.
title: Trump is crushing it, but the Republicans can still blow it in 2026 and 2028

author: Steff Danielle Thomas
description: European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen and Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum, in response to President Trump’s latest tariff announcement, say they are open to trade talks but won’t rule out taking countermeasures. Trump in his Saturday letters to von der Leyen and Sheinbaum announced a 30 percent tariff rate on goods imported into the…
title: EU, Mexico open to trade negotiations after latest Trump tariffs announced

author: Steff Danielle Thomas
description: European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen and Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum, in response to President Trump’s latest tariff announcement, say they are open to trade talks but won’t rule out taking countermeasures. Trump in his Saturday letters to von der Leyen and Sheinbaum announced a 30 percent tariff rate on goods imported into the…
title: EU, Mexico open to trade negotiations after latest Trump tariffs announced

author: Barak Sella, opinion contributor
description: The current moment demands a fundamental shift from managing conflict to actively building peace.
title: How the 12-day Israel-Iran war could rebuild the Middle East

author: Heather Madden, opinion contributor
description: Family caregivers already do so much. The least we can do is make it easier for them by eliminating unnecessary obstacles and improving the system so that it works for them, not against them.
title: America’s caregivers are struggling — this bipartisan bill can help them

author: Michelle Minton, opinion contributor
description: The Trump administration’s proposed cuts to the naloxone distribution program would gut programs that train and equip communities to respond to overdoses.
title: Cutting federal naloxone funding is cruel and will prove costly

author: Justin Balik, opinion contributor
description: Let’s learn the right lessons from this win and make it easier to achieve the next one.
title: Congestion pricing is working in New York, and it proves government can do big things

author: Zach Kaplan
description: Located roughly 140 miles southwest of Anchorage, Iliamna has been dormant for over a century.
title: Iliamna Volcano in Alaska ‘rumbling’ after being inactive for a century

author: Nicole Sanders
description: A recently-published study from the finance site WalletHub ranks 182 U.S. cities from most to least stressed.
title: These are the most, least stressed cities in the US: Study

author: Aris Folley
description: Senate Democrats are warning the Trump administration’s effort to claw back funds for foreign aid and public broadcasting programs threatens bipartisan negotiations to fund the government ahead of a September shutdown deadline. Republicans are ramping up efforts to try to pass a package of more than $9 billion in funding cuts requested by President Trump…
title: Democrats warn Trump’s DOGE cuts threaten government funding talks

author: Alejandra O'Connell-Domenech
description: Planned Parenthood stands to lose a huge portion of its federal funding under President Trump’s “big, beautiful bill,” which could result in the closure of up to 200 clinics, according to the organization.    Not only will many Americans lose access to abortion care if those clinics close, but millions of people treated by the provider…
title: Planned Parenthood ‘defunding’ threatens women’s health beyond abortion

author: Caroline Vakil
description: South Carolina is already setting the stage for the shadow 2028 presidential primaries as potential White House hopefuls from both parties travel to the Palmetto State. California Gov. Gavin Newsom (D) traveled through rural South Carolina during a two-day tour this past week, while Kentucky Gov. Andy Beshear (D) and Rep. Ro Khanna (D-Calif.) are…
title: South Carolina becomes early hot spot for potential 2028 candidates

author: Al Weaver
description: The decision by Sen. Thom Tillis (R-N.C.) to not seek reelection next year could give Republican leaders headaches as he looks forward to wielding his newfound political freedom. Tillis announced his retirement amid the GOP’s dash to pass the party’s tax and spending package, having cropped up as a surprise “no” vote in the final…
title: Tillis freedom to ‘call balls and strikes’ hands GOP leaders fresh headache

author: Filip Timotija
description: Secretary of State Marco Rubio began mass firings at the State Department on Monday, part of a reorganization plan to form a leaner foreign policy force that, he argues, will allow the United States to respond more nimbly by removing layers of bureaucracy. The department sent reduction in force (RIF) notices Friday morning to about 1,100…
title: Rubio begins mass firings at State Department: Key takeaways

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: Senate Democrats on Friday joined State Department employees in protest of the Trump administration’s decision to layoff 1,300 employees this week. “This is not America first. This is America in retreat,” Sen. Chris Van Hollen (D-Md.) said on Friday at a protest outside the department’s headquarters in Washington. “And we don’t want America retreating, do we?”…
title: Senate Democrats join fired State Department employees to rally against layoffs
